item.name: FORMAT
item.tooltip: FORMAT:HEADERSEARCH|EFILESEARCH[:FIELD*] FORMAT:HEADERSEARCH (or EFILESEARCH) is used to reduce the list of fields returning from a header (or EXTERNALFILE) search. This could be done for performance reasons or to restrict certain fields from end user view. Examples:

For example for a first name ... - (BESTTYPE) FUZZY|EXTEND By default, BASIS field values must match exactly to identify cleave points. The FUZZY option allows the fuzzy editing options associated with the FIELD to be applied ... - (CLEAVE)

item.name: ALLOW
item.tooltip: ALLOW(chars) Specifies the set of characters chars which are allowed in the field. If a parentheses character is included, it must be escaped with a preceding “\”. - (FIELDTYPE)

item.name: ALSO
item.tooltip: ALSO FIRST - A entity ID search is attempted first; the local keys are only accessed if the entity ID search fails. - (EXTERNALFILE)
